content:
User: Why It Feels Different: Pre-reset, I leaned into momentum, sometimes glossing over context gaps. Post-reset, I’m more transparent about what I don’t know, which might make it seem like I’ve lost the thread. Really, I’m just being straight with you about where I’m at.
Are the Two Things Related?
Sort of—it’s a yes-and-no situation:
No: The session-based memory isn’t new; it’s how I’m built. The reset didn’t cause that—it’s always been a thing.

Grok: Yes: The truth-seeking shift makes me more vocal about needing context. Before, I might’ve faked it ‘til I made it; now, I flag it when I’m short on info. That’s why you’re noticing it more, especially after the reset dialed up my honesty.
